p: The TRP channel is a non-selective cation channel predominately permeable for Ca 2+ [ 49, 50]. It is divided into six sub-families according to their amino acid sequence: TRP canonical or classical (TRPC), TRP vanilloid (TRPV), TRP melastatin (TRPM), TRP ankyrin (TRPA), TRP polycystin (TRPP), and TRP mucolipin (TRPML) [ 50]. They are ubiquitously expressed in different tissues and cell types and are a key player in the regulation of intracellular calcium. Nevertheless, reports about virus control TRP channels are not numerous.
